page.title: 13SEGAS SUPPLIES
page.content: The High Pressure Main Gas Terminal at the back of Alfriston is used by SEGAS to lower the gas pressure before it is distributed to individual premises at Eastbourne and Seaford. The pressure is reduced via automatic regulators and is connected directly to the main SEGAS Central Control Room at Croydon. North Sea Gas comes along under the South Downs Way in a 12 inch pipe to the Terminal. It was originally planned in 1964 for the use of manufactured gas from Portslade but since the discovery of natural gas in the North Sea this main is now part of an extensive network of mains covering S.E.England.
